item.title: 3 New Dev Tools I Picked Up and What I Like Most About Them
item.description: As a strong believer in the idea that a new job means new habits, I’m always looking for ways to improve my workflow and boost productivity. In this post, I’ll be sharing 3 new tools that I’ve started using and highlighting the features that I like most. So, if you’re looking for some new tools to add to your developer toolkit, read on!

item.title: Bouncing Back from Layoff: How I Coped and Found a New Way Forward
item.description: “Losing your job can be a tough time, and it’s not uncommon to feel lonely and uncertain. In this blog post, I share my own experience of being laid off and how I coped with it. I’ll add some tips that can help with the emotional and practical aspects of job loss. Whether you’re currently going through a layoff or just want to be prepared for the future, this post is for you.

item.title: 5 Takeaways From My First Job as a Software Developer
item.description: 1 - Reading and understanding othersâ€™ code is one of the most valuable skills you can develop. 90% of my first challenges were integrating into an existing code base so most of my day included reading and debugging to figure out how things work. I dedicated time to learn and unravel the relevant code base in order to spot the exact place to seamlessly blend in and add my own code or refactor existing code.
